TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed StatusBarPanelBorderStyle extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the appearance of the border for a on a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This enumeration is used by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.BorderStyle%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> class. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.BorderStyle%2A> property enables you to specify the style of border to display on a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> within a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the StatusBarPanelBorderStyle enumeration and how to handle the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.PanelClick> event.
To run the example, paste the following code in a form. Call the `InitializeStatusBarPanels` method in the form's constructor or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Load> event-handling method.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.s_11_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.s_11_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.windows.forms.s_11_1.cpp)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelBorderStyle None = int32(1)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelBorderStyle Raised = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The is displayed with a three-dimensional raised border.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelBorderStyle Sunken = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The is displayed with a three-dimensional sunken border.
